question.title: How to find which NIC & IP was used for an http Query
question.body:
Using the "new" JDK 11 HTTP Client, is there any way to determine which NIC & IP Address (IPv4 / IPv6) was used for the query?

Source code example:

import java.net.URI;
import java.net.http.HttpClient;
import java.net.http.HttpRequest;
import java.net.http.HttpResponse.BodyHandlers;

public class MyHttpClient {

    public static void main(final String[] args) throws Exception {

        final     var uri        = new URI("https://www.stackoverflow.com");

        final     var request    = HttpRequest.newBuilder().uri(uri).build();
        try(final var httpClient = HttpClient .newBuilder()         .build())
        {
            final var result     = httpClient.send(request, BodyHandlers.ofByteArray());

            System.out.println("rc="  +   result.statusCode());
            System.out.println(new String(result.body()));
        }
    }
}

question_comments.body: Curiosity. I just want to know. :-)

Probably not? The HTTP classes in Java seem to shield the user from that level of detail. The real question is why do you need that information? It feels that it may be an XY Problem. What is the problem you are trying to resolve by getting this information?
